question: When driving in fog, drivers should use:
option1: parking lights.
option2: low beam headlights.

question: __________ are blue with white letters and symbols.
option1: Service signs
option2: Destination signs (guide signs)

question: Air bags are meant to _________ seat belts.
option1: fix
option2: replace

question: To avoid becoming an aggressive driver, you should:
option1: drive above the posted speed limit.
option2: tailgate the driver in front of you.

question: Drivers may need more space in front of their vehicle:
option1: when carrying a heavy load or pulling a trailer.
option2: when following motorcycles.

question: When an aggressive driver confronts you, you should:
option1: Try to move away safely.
option2: Remain calm and relaxed.

question: You should allow for an extra cushion of space when following large vehicles because:
option1: this will encourage the drivers of large vehicles to drive around you.
option2: large vehicles take longer to stop.
option3: the drivers of large vehicles may not be able to see you when you are directly behind them.

question: This road sign means:
option1: One Way
option2: Limited parking

question: This road sign means:
option1: Pedestrian Crossing
option2: Multiple Turns

question: This road sign means:
option1: Hill or downgrade up ahead
option2: No trucks allowed

question: Collisions can happen more often when:
option1: one lane of traffic is traveling faster than the others.
option2: all vehicles are traveling at the posted speed limit.
option3: one vehicle is traveling faster than the flow of traffic.

question: Signs with orange backgrounds mean:
option1: side road ahead.
option2: railroad crossing.

question: ________ are required to stop for railroad crossings.
option1: School buses
option2: Cattle trucks

question: Blocking an intersection during rush hour traffic is not permitted:
option1: unless you entered the intersection on a green light.
option2: under any circumstances.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Divided highway ahead
option2: Merging traffic

question: Which of the following is true about the Anti-Locking Brake System?
option1: It allows drivers to steer during an emergency braking situation.
option2: It prevents skidding.

question: This road sign means:
option1: No right turn
option2: No left turn

question: ___________ normally are white rectangles with black letters or symbols.
option1: Regulation signs (regulatory signs)
option2: Warning signs

question: Stopping distances:
option1: are not affected by vehicle speed.
option2: increase as vehicle speed increases.

question: A bad car suspension can cause:
option1: squealing brakes.
option2: pumping brakes.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Pedestrian crossing
option2: School zone

question: What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
option1: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
option2: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.

question: Your red traffic signal changes to green while a pedestrian is crossing in your traffic lane. The right of way should be given:
option1: by the pedestrian, but only when vehicles are turning left.
option2: by the pedestrian.

question: Alcohol:
option1: makes drivers more prone to take chances.
option2: increases reaction time.

question: Which of the following must you obey over the others?
option1: Police officer
option2: Red light

question: Drivers should make room for cars entering freeways by:
option1: slowing down.
option2: moving over a lane if there is no other vehicle next to them.

question: Green and white signs:
option1: are mainly used at intersections and driveways.
option2: give information about directions and distances.
option3: warn drivers of unexpected road conditions.

question: You hear a siren close by but can not see where the emergency vehicle is. What do you do?
option1: Keep driving until you are sure the emergency vehicle is headed toward you.
option2: Stop immediately and activate your emergency flashers.
option3: Pull over to the right side of the road and stop until you are sure the emergency vehicle is not headed toward you.

question: What is the most important rule to remember in any emergency?
option1: Call the police.
option2: Run away.

question: The use of alcohol and/or drugs affects:
option1: alertness and judgement.
option2: concentration and reaction time.

question: When approaching a construction site, drivers should:
option1: slow down and adjust their driving manner.
option2: honk their horn to alert construction workers of their presence.
option3: accelerate to get out of the way quickly.

question: When following motorcycles, drivers should:
option1: keep more space in front of their vehicle.
option2: reduce the minimum following distance.
option3: try to pass them as they have different braking capabilities than other motor vehicles.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Low clearance
option2: Do not enter

question: Never make a U-turn from:
option1: the lane you’re in.
option2: the left part of the lane nearest to the centerline of the roadway.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Steep downgrade
option2: Slippery when wet

question: Where must a pedestrian walk when there are no sidewalks?
option1: On the side of the road, in the same direction of traffic.
option2: In the middle of the road, facing oncoming traffic.
option3: On the side of the road, facing the traffic.

question: Regulatory signs are:
option1: green.
option2: white.

question: What should drivers do when they see this sign?
option1: Allow others to merge smoothly.
option2: Look to the left and right for other traffic.
option3: Make sure the bridge is clear of oncoming traffic before they cross.

question: A school bus ahead of you in your lane is stopped with red lights flashing. You must:
option1: reduce your speed, change lanes and pass.
option2: stop until all the children have left the bus.
option3: stop until the lights stop flashing.

question: Before entering a curve, you should:
option1: reduce your speed.
option2: activate your turn signal.

question: When driving at night, if an approaching car is using its high-beams you should:
option1: turn your lights on and off.
option2: look toward the right edge of the road.
option3: look toward the left edge of the road.

question: At intersections where two or more drivers stop at STOP signs at the same time and they are at right angles:
option1: the driver on the right must yield to the driver on the left.
option2: the driver on the left must yield to the driver on the right.
option3: the driver who is late for work has the right-of-way.

question: After parking, are you allowed to open a door on the road side of your vehicle?
option1: No, never.
option2: Yes, always.
option3: Yes, but only if it does not interfere with bicyclists and other traffic.

question: This road sign means:
option1: No U-turns
option2: No right turn

question: At intersections with a yield sign, you must:
option1: yield the right-of-way to cross traffic close enough to cause conflict.
option2: yield to the vehicles on your left only.

question: When following a motorcycle, drivers must remember that motorcycles can ____________ than other vehicles.
option1: accelerate much faster
option2: stop much more quickly

question: You can reduce the chance of a collision with a large vehicle if you:
option1: delay near it.
option2: cut abruptly in front of it.
option3: pay close attention to the turn signals.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Winding road ahead
option2: When pavement is wet, reduce your speed
option3: Watch for vehicles entering from the side

question: You should never depend on your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes. Why?
option1: Mirrors need to be adjusted.
option2: Mirrors are useless.
option3: Mirrors leave “blind spots” behind both sides of vehicles.

question: Blind spots around a large vehicle are _________________ than the blind spots around a car.
option1: larger and deeper
option2: narrower and shorter

question: Sudden wind gusts on highways:
option1: are generally caused by dust and dirt blowing around.
option2: only affect large vehicles.
option3: can cause one to lose control of their vehicle.

question: A flashing yellow light:
option1: warns drivers to proceed with caution.
option2: is used at dangerous intersections.

question: When driving in foggy weather, drivers should:
option1: put their lights on high beam.
option2: put their emergency flashers on.
option3: put their lights on low beam.

question: This road sign means:
option1: No stopping
option2: No U-turn

question: This road sign means:
option1: Watch for bicycles
option2: Bicycle parking ahead
option3: Bicycles are not allowed in this area

question: To keep the driver behind you at a safe distance you should:
option1: drive 5 MPH slower than the car behind.
option2: keep a steady speed.
option3: drive 5 MPH faster than the car behind.

question: If you approach a flashing red traffic light, you should treat the intersection the same as:
option1: a stop sign.
option2: a yield sign.

question: When is it safe to pass another vehicle?
option1: Whenever signs and/or markings permit passing other vehicles.
option2: When you are entering a curve and there are no oncoming vehicles.
option3: When you are driving through an intersection and there are no oncoming vehicles.

question: Where must you position your vehicle when you prepare to make a left turn from a two-way roadway into a one-way roadway?
option1: As close as possible to the center line.
option2: As far to the right as possible.

question: This sign means:
option1: Vehicles may only turn left.
option2: Left turns in both directions of travel are not permitted.
option3: The center lane is shared for left turns.

question: A traffic sign with a red circle around and a slash over a symbol means:
option1: Do not drive faster than the posted speed limit.
option2: the maneuver shown on the sign should be executed with extreme caution.
option3: the maneuver shown by the symbol is not allowed.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Right turn on red light permitted
option2: Stop Sign Ahead

question: Which of the following is true about large trucks?
option1: Large trucks can lose speed on long or steep uphill climbs.
option2: It takes longer for large trucks to get up to speed when they enter traffic.
option3: The other answers are both correct.

question: When entering a freeway, you should check traffic by:
option1: using the inside mirror.
option2: using both the inside and outside mirrors.
option3: using the side mirror and looking over your shoulder.

question: This regulatory sign tells drivers that:
option1: traffic in the right lane must go straight.
option2: all vehicles must turn left immediately.
option3: traffic in the left lane must turn left at the intersection ahead.

question: When is the pavement most slippery?
option1: When it is been raining from at least one hour.
option2: If it is been raining several hours.
option3: When it has just begun to rain.

question: This sign warns drivers that:
option1: the right lane ends.
option2: there is a one lane bridge ahead.

question: Aggressive driving includes:
option1: quick lane changes without a signal.
option2: All of the above.

question: In 55 MPH traffic you are least likely to be involved in a collision if you:
option1: stay within that speed range.
option2: drive a few MPH slower than most.
option3: drive a few MPH faster than most.

question: You are driving and you are feeling drowsy. You should:
option1: avoid drinking coffee.
option2: find a safe place to stop for a break.
option3: turn on the radio to keep you awake.

question: The ‘Slower Traffic Keep Right’ sign is used:
option1: at most intersections.
option2: on multiple lane highways.

question: Which of the following drugs could affect your ability to drive?
option1: A cold remedy.
option2: Marijuana.

question: It is unlawful­ to:
option1: pass within 250 feet of any intersection.
option2: exceed the posted speed limit when passing.
option3: pass within 150 feet of any railroad crossing.

question: A four-way stop sign means:
option1: traffic from all four directions must stop.
option2: if two vehicles reach the intersection at the same time, the driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.

question: In rainy weather, drivers should be most careful when turning or stopping:
option1: after it has been raining for at least two hours.
option2: during the first half hour of rain.
option3: when it is been raining all day.

question: To avoid traction loss from hydroplaning, drivers should:
option1: apply the brakes as soon as the car starts to skid.
option2: slow down.

question: Where there is no bicycle lane, where on the road must a bicyclist ride?
option1: near the left edge of the road.
option2: on the left shoulder of the road.
option3: near the right curb or edge of the road.

question: When in a vehicle, wear a seat belt:
option1: on long trips.
option2: at all times.

question: Drivers must yield the right-of-way to pedestrians when:
option1: pedestrians are crossing the road in marked crosswalks.
option2: All of the above.
option3: the driver is turning a corner and pedestrians are crossing with the light.

question: Diamond-shaped signs:
option1: indicate no pass zones.
option2: typically provide guidance to drivers.
option3: are used to warn of hazards on roadways.

question: This sign means:
option1: Warning: U-turn ahead.
option2: Hairpin corner ahead.

question: The shape of a route sign tells you:
option1: the type of route you are on.
option2: that the route you are on might be dangerous.
option3: the speed limit on that route.

question: Drivers should use high beam headlights when:
option1: when they come within 50 feet of an oncoming vehicle.
option2: there are no oncoming vehicles approaching.

question: You go with a group of friends to a social event, and you plan to have a few drinks. You should:
option1: arrange to ride home with a friend who does not drink.
option2: avoid alternating between drinks with alcohol and drinks without any alcohol.
option3: make alcohol the focus of the event.

question: Before changing lanes or attempting to pass another vehicle, you should:
option1: check your blind spots and, mirrors.
option2: signal your intention before changing lanes.

question: To avoid panic stops, you should:
option1: pump your brakes to make sure they work.
option2: drive with your window down.
option3: scan the road ahead for hazards.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Winding road
option2: Slippery when wet

question: Slowing down just to look at collisions or anything else out of ordinary:
option1: improves traffic flow.
option2: helps prevent rear-end collisions.

question: This road sign means:
option1: You must come to a complete stop
option2: Drive with caution and be ready to stop

question: Driving at excessive speed:
option1: improves your reaction time.
option2: does not increase the chance of a crash.

question: Which shape is a warning sign?
option1: Triangle
option2: Diamond

question: Which signs have black letters on a yellow or orange background?
option1: Regulatory signs (vertical rectangle)
option2: Railroad advance warning signs (round)

question: Does a vehicle prepared to enter a traffic circle or rotary have right-of-way over vehicles in the circle?
option1: Yes, but only if they are entering the rotary from the right lane.
option2: No. Vehicles already in the circle have the right-of-way.

question: No Zones are areas around trucks where cars:
option1: disappear into blind spots or are so close to the truck that the driver's ability to stop or maneuver safely is restricted.
option2: can turn safely because several car lengths have been left between the truck and car.
option3: can travel behind trucks at constant speed and have no risks of being involved in a collision.

question: This sign means:
option1: No passing zone ahead.
option2: Do not to enter if your vehicle is taller than the height listed on the sign.
option3: Narrow bridge ahead. Slow down and drive with caution.

question: This road sign warns drivers that:
option1: left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
option2: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.
option3: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.

question: When driving in work zones, drivers should:
option1: pass the vehicle ahead when safe.
option2: keep a safe following distance.
option3: tailgate the vehicle ahead while reducing their speed.

question: A green arrow on a traffic light means:
option1: You must turn in that direction after coming to a complete stop.
option2: You can turn in the direction of the arrow.
option3: You may not turn in the direction of the arrow.

question: The sign in the picture:
option1: is found at most intersections and indicates that drivers must yield to other vehicles.
option2: is a Construction and Maintenance Traffic Control sign.
option3: is displayed on the rear of slow moving vehicles.

question: When you see this sign you should:
option1: turn right.
option2: watch for traffic to the right.

question: Drivers may legally block an intersection:
option1: under no circumstances.
option2: only during rush hour traffic.
option3: only after entering the intersection on a green light.

question: On the highway, you should look well down the road:
option1: in order to avoid emergency braking or steering.
option2: because it usually takes 500 feet or more to come to a complete stop on the highway.
option3: because it helps you keep up with traffic.

question: If a driver follows you too closely, you should:
option1: brake suddenly.
option2: move to another lane if possible.

question: When driving in a construction zone you should:
option1: come to a complete stop and check road conditions.
option2: expect the unexpected.

question: The speed limit in school zones is:
option1: 20 MPH
option2: 35 MPH

question: When changing lanes, you should remember that:
option1: you should look over your left shoulder for a left lane change and your right shoulder for a right lane change.
option2: vehicles with two outside mirrors have no blind spots.
option3: You only need to turn and look over your right shoulder for lane changes to the right or left.

question: When approaching someone using a white cane or guide dog, drivers should:
option1: honk their horn as they proceed past them.
option2: carefully drive around them.
option3: stop until the person is well away from the roadway or path of travel.

question: Your driving ability can be affected by:
option1: three drinks or more.
option2: just one drink.

question: The only effective way to reduce your blood alcohol content (BAC) is:
option1: drinking coffee.
option2: fresh air.
option3: not to drink over a period of time.

question: When driving in work zones, drivers should:
option1: closely follow the driver in front of them.
option2: maintain their speed through the work zone.
option3: reduce their speed and be prepared to stop.

question: You want to turn left at an intersection ahead. A car reaches the intersection from the opposite direction and moves straight ahead. You:
option1: may not enter the intersection to prepare for your left turn if the light is green.
option2: can turn left. You have the right of way.
option3: must wait for the car to go through before you turn.

question: Driver distractions include:
option1: Slowing down to look at crash scene.
option2: Avoiding unnecessary lane changes.
option3: turning your headlights on when rain and fog make it hard to see.

question: Signs that indicate a No Passing Zone tell drivers that:
option1: it is not safe to pass.
option2: not passing other vehicles is prohibited.
option3: passing is only permitted in daylight hours.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Four-lane traffic ahead
option2: Divided highway ahead

question: As they approach the top of a hill, drivers should:
option1: prepare to stop if needed.
option2: speed up slightly.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Yield the right-of-way
option2: Side road

question: This road sign means:
option1: Right turn is not permitted
option2: Left turns are permitted
option3: You may turn right after yielding the right-of-way to oncoming traffic

question: Before a school bus stops to load passengers, the driver will usually flash:
option1: yellow warning lights.
option2: red warning lights.

question: What does this sign indicate?
option1: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.
option2: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.
option3: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.

question: When changing lanes:
option1: look over your shoulder to make sure no one is in the blind spot.
option2: change lane before checking the inside rearview mirror.
option3: slow down and check your left mirror.

question: A solid yellow line next to a broken yellow line means that vehicles:
option1: next to the solid line may pass.
option2: next to the broken line may pass.

question: The traffic light is green and you want to drive straight through an intersection. If a car is already in the intersection and is making a turn, you must:
option1: let that car complete its turn before you enter the intersection.
option2: drive through the intersection. You have the right-of-way.
option3: enter the intersection and then stop.

question: When riding in a vehicle equipped with air bags is, children ages 12 and under are safer:
option1: buckled up in the front seat.
option2: buckled up in the back seat.
option3: in the bed of a pick-up truck.

question: What is the meaning of red traffic signs?
option1: Regulatory.
option2: High emphasis warning.
option3: Stop, do not enter or wrong way.

question: A diamond-shaped sign is a:
option1: regulatory sign.
option2: school zone sign.

question: When you come to a flashing yellow light, you must:
option1: speed up to beat the red light.
option2: slow down and cross carefully.

question: If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to expressway speed, you should:
option1: reduce your speed to 15 MPH or less and blend with traffic.
option2: enter the expressway and accelerate quickly.
option3: stop and wait for a large space in traffic.

question: This road sign means:
option1: U-turns are prohibited
option2: Drivers are about to enter a one way street the wrong way
option3: Drivers may proceed if the way is clear

question: Drivers should always be looking:
option1: directly in front of the car.
option2: at the left lane.
option3: beside, ahead and to the rear of the vehicle.

question: If the driver of an oncoming vehicle fails to dim the lights, you should look:
option1: toward the right side of the road.
option2: toward the center of the roadway.

question: Drivers should change lanes:
option1: often.
option2: gradually and carefully.

question: What do flashing red lights on a school bus indicate?
option1: The bus is about to stop.
option2: The bus is stopped to load or discharge passengers.
option3: Traffic that approaches from either direction may proceed.

question: What should you do if you see smoke come from under the hood?
option1: Try to fight the fire yourself.
option2: Call the fire department and then pull off the road and park your vehicle.
option3: Pull off the road and park your vehicle. Turn off the ignition, get away from the car and call the fire department.

question: When you see this sign you should:
option1: slow your speed and do not pass other vehicles.
option2: slow your speed and be prepared to stop.
option3: increase your speed and try to pass other vehicles.

question: This road sign is:
option1: a speed reduction sign.
option2: a warning sign.

question: In work zones, barriers such as drums, panels and cones are used to:
option1: reduce the flow of traffic.
option2: keep traffic out of hazardous work zones.
option3: keep workers out of the work zone.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Crossroad
option2: Hospital parking ahead

question: What should you do if your headlights suddenly go out?
option1: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
option2: Use your emergency lights, parking lights or directional signals.
option3: Brake immediately and activate your emergency lights.

question: When in a motor vehicle on a highway, it is:
option1: acceptable to drink alcoholic beverages if you are not driving.
option2: illegal to possess an open container of alcohol in the passenger compartment.
option3: permissible to drink a moderate amount of alcohol when driving with a passenger.

question: This sign warns of a ________ ahead.
option1: no passing zone
option2: hill

question: Road signs that point out scenic areas and parks are:
option1: black and orange.
option2: brown and white.

question: Following another vehicle too closely is known as:
option1: closetailing.
option2: speedgating.

question: Traffic accidents resulting in personal injury must be reported:
option1: immediately.
option2: within 30 days.

question: You should add antifreeze to washer fluid:
option1: to protect your windshield from extensive damage.
option2: to protect your wipers against moisture.
option3: to keep the washer fluid from freezing.

question: Roads are the most slippery:
option1: the first rain after a dry spell.
option2: for the first 2 hours of a rain storm.
option3: after it has been raining for an hour or more.

question: The picture shows:
option1: a reversible road sign.
option2: a speeding fines doubled sign.

question: The extra space in front of a large truck is needed for:
option1: other drivers when they want to pass the truck.
option2: the truck driver to stop the vehicle.
option3: other drivers when merging onto a freeway.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Keep right
option2: School zone ahead

question: If a child is about to run into the street, you should:
option1: flash your headlights.
option2: call the police.
option3: sound a sharp blast of your horn.

question: When passing a vehicle, it is safe to return to your lane when:
option1: you can see both headlights of the vehicle you passed in your rearview mirror.
option2: you look over your shoulder and see no vehicle behind you.
option3: the driver you just passed signals you over.

question: What do warning signs mean?
option1: Drivers are approaching a location where there is a special rule.
option2: Danger ahead.

question: Drivers should allow an extra cushion of space when following:
option1: a passenger car.
option2: drivers whose view to the rear is blocked.

question: When passing another vehicle, you should return to your lane if:
option1: you have passed the other vehicle’s front bumper.
option2: you can see both headlights in the rearview mirror.
option3: you are at least 25 feet in front of the passed vehicle.

question: Drivers turning left must yield to:
option1: oncoming vehicles turning left.
option2: oncoming vehicles going straight.

question: When they see this sign, drivers:
option1: should be prepared to make sharp turns at a high speed.
option2: need to be prepared to turn right and then left quickly.
option3: should not speed up or brake quickly.

question: What should you do if one of your tires blows out?
option1: Leave the road immediately.
option2: Hold the steering wheel tight and slowly take your foot off the gas pedal.
option3: Hold the steering wheel tight and brake immediately to avoid the risk of skidding.

question: To avoid hydroplaning, drivers should:
option1: apply the brakes firmly.
option2: slow down.

question: What does a flashing yellow light mean?
option1: Drivers may move forward with caution.
option2: The same thing as a stop sign.

question: A crosswalk is:
option1: a special type of 4-way intersection.
option2: the area where pedestrians may cross the road.
option3: an area designated for blind persons.

question: A curb painted red means:
option1: No parking or stopping
option2: Reserved for passengers pick up or drop off
option3: Parking is for disabled persons with a special placard or plate.

question: Drivers may cross a double yellow line to pass another vehicle if:
option1: the vehicle ahead moves to the right to let them pass.
option2: the yellow line next to their side of the road is broken.
option3: the yellow line next to the other side of the road is broken.

question: What does this road sign indicate?
option1: Interstate highway
option2: Area reserved for people with disabilities

question: You are approaching an intersection with a traffic signal indicating a steady yellow light. If you have not already entered the intersection, you should:
option1: slow down and proceed with caution through the intersection.
option2: stop before entering the intersection if it is safe to do so.
option3: speed up to cross the intersection before the light turns red.

question: After passing a vehicle, it is safe to return to your lane when:
option1: you can see both headlights of the vehicle you just passed in your rearview mirror.
option2: you are at least 100 feet ahead of the vehicle you passed.
option3: the driver you passed slows down to let you return to your lane.

question: You may drive faster than the posted speed limit:
option1: when your lane is empty.
option2: when passing another vehicle, as long as it is safe to do so.

question: This sign warns drivers of:
option1: a sharp turn.
option2: a cross road.

question: A thumping sound can be a warning:
option1: of a steering failure.
option2: of a brake failure.
option3: that a tire blowout is about to occur.

question: When changing lanes, drivers should never:
option1: glance over their shoulder to check for blind spots.
option2: change lanes abruptly.
option3: check to see if other drivers are moving into the same lane.

question: The octagonal shape is used:
option1: for stop signs and railroad advance warning signs.
option2: to warn drivers of existing or possible hazards on roadways.

question: When driving at night, drivers should:
option1: look directly into the oncoming headlights of approaching vehicles.
option2: increase their following distance.

question: If you see orange construction signs and cones on a freeway, you must:
option1: make a U-turn because the lane ends ahead.
option2: be prepared for workers and equipment ahead.
option3: maintain your current speed while changing lanes.

question: What can you do to prevent skids on snow and ice?
option1: Brake early and gently.
option2: Allow the wheels to keep turning.

question: When being passed by another vehicle, drivers should:
option1: slow down.
option2: slightly increase their speed.

question: What does this sign indicate?
option1: Low ground clearance railroad crossing
option2: Parallel railroad crossing (crossroad)

question: Regulatory signs are:
option1: Suggestions
option2: Law

question: This sign warns drivers that:
option1: there is a winding road ahead.
option2: the highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways. Drivers should keep to the right.
option3: there is a double curve ahead.

question: If a bus needs to make a right turn and you are also turning right:
option1: squeeze between the bus and the curb.
option2: wait until the bus turns before turning right.
option3: try to turn right before the bus does.

question: One broken line indicates:
option1: You can pass other vehicles and change lanes, if it is safe.
option2: You can change lanes, but only when traffic conditions or obstructions in the road make it necessary.
option3: You can not pass other vehicles or go across the line.

question: This sign warns drivers that:
option1: there is a double curve ahead.
option2: there is a winding road ahead.
option3: they must turn either to the right or left.

question: What is the first thing to do when you make a three-point turn?
option1: Signal with your right turn signal, then pull over to the right and stop.
option2: Turn left, go across the road so you come to a stop while you face the edge of the road.
option3: Signal with your left turn signal, then check carefully for traffic coming toward you.

question: Drivers should check their rearview mirrors:
option1: only when slowing down.
option2: to see if a truck is in their blind spot.
option3: often to see how traffic is moving behind them.

question: After you stop for a school bus, you must:
option1: wait until the red lights stop flashing.
option2: pass the bus before the red lights stop flashing.

question: If you meet a stopped school bus with the lights flashing and the signal arm extended, you should:
option1: proceed at 15 MPH or less, if no children are present.
option2: watch for children and proceed at normal speed.

question: A steady yellow light means:
option1: Be prepared to stop for the red light.
option2: Drive with caution.
option3: Be prepared to go. The light will soon be green.

question: The driver of an emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can legally:
option1: exceed the speed limit
option2: pass red lights.

question: A vehicle that enters a road from a driveway:
option1: must yield to traffic approaching from the right, while it has the right-of-way over vehicles approaching from the left.
option2: has the right-of-way.
option3: must stop and yield the right-of-way to traffic on the roadway and to pedestrians.

question: What does this road sign indicate?
option1: Drivers have the right of way over bikes turning left.
option2: Motor vehicles entering an exclusive right-turn lane must weave across bicycle traffic in bicycle lanes.
option3: Vehicles turning left must yield to bikes entering a right turn lane.

question: What should you do if your rear wheels start to skid?
option1: Steer left if your rear wheels slide right.
option2: Turn the steering wheel in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.
option3: If the vehicle has ABS, pump the pedal carefully.

question: In the following situations, drivers should increase their following interval:
option1: When following vehicles that are required to come to a stop at railroad crossings.
option2: When it is hard to see ahead because of bad weather.

question: When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, if the road you enter has two lanes, you:
option1: must turn into its right lane.
option2: must turn into its left lane.

question: After passing a vehicle, it is safe to return to your lane:
option1: when you see the front bumper of the other vehicle in your mirror.
option2: when you can no longer see the vehicle over your right shoulder.

question: When they see this sign, drivers should:
option1: be ready to brake sharply and stop.
option2: yield to trucks coming from the hill on the right.
option3: be ready to shift to lower gear.

question: When a pedestrian is crossing a street guided carrying a white cane, drivers must:
option1: always yield the right-of-way.
option2: yield the right of way at corners only.
option3: help the pedestrian cross the street.

question: What is the meaning of blue traffic signs?
option1: Blue indicates road user services.
option2: They give directional information.
option3: A blue background indicates a regulatory sign.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Pedestrian crossing ahead
option2: Pedestrians must not cross here

question: If traffic on the other side of an intersection is backed up and you cannot get completely through, you must:
option1: wait until traffic ahead is clear.
option2: enter the intersection and try to avoid blocking it.
option3: enter the intersection and proceed with caution.

question: Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
option1: they can not safely return to the right lane before any oncoming vehicle comes within 200 feet of them.
option2: their lane has a solid yellow center line.

question: This warning sign:
option1: indicates the suggested highest safe speed.
option2: shows the current speed limit that all vehicles traveling in the direction of the arrow must not exceed.
option3: provides advance notice to upcoming speed limit change.

question: The golden rule of driving is to:
option1: put on your emergency flashers when driving at night.
option2: drive faster than the vehicle behind you.
option3: treat others the way you want to be treated.

question: This road sign tells drivers that:
option1: they must turn either to the right or left.
option2: they must change lane immediately.
option3: the one-way street or roadway ahead ends.

question: This sign means:
option1: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
option2: A road crosses the main highway ahead.
option3: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.

question: A driver who approaches an intersection:
option1: must drive straight through the intersection, even if another vehicle is already in the intersection.
option2: must yield the right-of-way to traffic already in the intersection.
option3: has the right-of-way over traffic already in the intersection.

question: If your wheels drop off the pavement edge, you should:
option1: turn gradually back onto the roadway when safe.
option2: stop.
option3: turn back onto the roadway immediately.

question: If your brakes are wet, you can dry them by:
option1: pull over to the right and wait until it stops raining.
option2: having them checked by a mechanic.

question: This is the shape and color of a ________ sign.
option1: do not enter
option2: yield

question: This road sign means:
option1: Sharp right turn ahead.
option2: There is a series of sharp turns up ahead on the road
option3: A road joins from the right

question: Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
option1: they approach the top of a hill on a two-way road and can not see over it.
option2: they can not safely return to the right lane before they reach a solid yellow center line for the right lane.

question: On average, how long does it take your body to remove the alcohol contained in 5 ounces of wine?
option1: 30 minutes.
option2: 3 hours.

question: If a tire suddenly goes flat while you are driving, you should:
option1: slow down gradually do not apply the brake.
option2: apply the brake firmly and stop.
option3: pump the brake pedal 5-7 times until the vehicle stops.

question: What does a yellow arrow signal mean?
option1: Vehicles moving in all directions must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.
option2: The same as a green light.
option3: The same as the yellow light, but applies only to movement in the direction of the arrow.

question: Who is most at risk?
option1: Experienced drivers.
option2: Drivers who are driving long distances without rest breaks.

question: You should use turn signals to indicate your intention with sufficient time to allow other drivers to see the signal:
option1: if it’s raining.
option2: BEFORE you move.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Left lane widens
option2: Right lane ends

question: This road sign means:
option1: Two-way traffic ahead
option2: Four-lane traffic ahead

question: Drivers have to yield to pedestrians:
option1: even if the pedestrian is not obeying traffic controls.
option2: only when the pedestrian is in the crosswalk.
option3: only if the pedestrians have a green light.

question: When you reach an intersection with stop signs at all four corners, you must yield the right-of-way to the driver:
option1: arrived before you.
option2: on your left.

question: When you change lanes:
option1: look over your shoulder in the direction you plan to move.
option2: look in the left side mirror.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Lane shifting
option2: Do not block intersection

question: There is no crosswalk and a pedestrian is crossing your lane ahead. You should:
option1: slow down as you pass the pedestrian.
option2: stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing the street.
option3: make eye contact and then pass the pedestrian.

question: The basic color for traffic control devices used in construction zones is:
option1: orange.
option2: red.

question: Which shape is a yield sign?
option1: Upside-down triangle
option2: Diamond

question: If you see a “lane closed ahead” sign you should:
option1: make a U-turn. You are on the wrong side of the road.
option2: speed to the end of the closed lane and try to get into the other lane.
option3: merge into the correct lane when it is safe.

question: As you enter a roundabout you should slow down and:
option1: yield to any vehicle coming from your left in the roundabout.
option2: yield to pedestrians and bicyclist crossing before entering the roundabout.

question: This road sign means:
option1: No Turning
option2: No left turn

question: Drivers often fail to see a motorcycle headed toward them. Why?
option1: It is difficult to judge a motorcycle's speed.
option2: Motorcycles are hard to see.

question: A defensive driver:
option1: knows when it is safe to pass other vehicles.
option2: considers what other drivers might do and is always prepared to act.
option3: never drives below the speed limit.

question: If your car becomes disabled on a highway, you should:
option1: park with all four wheels off the highway, if possible.
option2: stop in the right lane.

question: This road sign means:
option1: A four-way intersection is ahead
option2: A steep grade is ahead

question: This road sign means:
option1: Winding Road Ahead
option2: Persons with Disabilities Parking

question: This road sign means:
option1: Merging traffic
option2: Steep hill
option3: Watch for trucks entering from the side

question: What is the meaning of orange traffic signs?
option1: Construction and maintenance warning.
option2: Yield.
option3: Warning of school, pedestrian, and bicycling activity.

question: The sign in the picture:
option1: is used to advise motorists of the appropriate ramp speed at the highway exit point.
option2: shows the highest speed drivers can travel at the exit of the intersection.
option3: indicates the minimum ramp speed at the highway exit point.

question: A good rule of thumb for drivers sharing the road with a truck is:
option1: it is better to drive to the immediate right of the cab.
option2: always try to stay alongside a truck, but never drive right behind it.
option3: if you can’t see the truck driver in their side mirror, they can’t see you.

question: When another vehicle is passing you:
option1: pull your vehicle as far to the right as possible without leaving the pavement.
option2: stay in your lane and maintain speed unless there is an emergency.
option3: stay in your lane and reduce speed.

question: If you get on a wrong expressway exit, you must:
option1: drive in reverse to return to the expressway.
option2: use the the exit ramp to accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.
option3: get off at the next exit and look for signs that tell you how to return to the expressway.

question: In heavy rain, tires can begin to ride on the water that is on top of the road pavement. This is called:
option1: waterplaning.
option2: rideplaning.

question: If cars approaching from opposite directions reach an intersection at the same time:
option1: a car that moves straight must yield to cars that turn left.
option2: a car that turns right must yield to cars that move straight or turn left.
option3: a car that turns left must yield to cars that move straight or turn right.

question: On slippery roads, drivers should:
option1: leave more space in front of their vehicle.
option2: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.

question: You are considered to be driving under the influence when your blood alcohol concentration (BAC) is ____ or more.
If another driver is following you too closely on a two-lane road, you should:
option1: try to increase the distance from the car behind.
option2: apply your brakes firmly while turning left.
option3: reduce your speed gradually to encourage the tailgater to pass.

question: This regulatory road sign indicates that:
option1: Slower vehicles traveling on multiple lane highways must stay in the right hand lane.
option2: The right hand lane is reserved for buses and car-pool vehicles.
option3: Vehicles must slow down and stay in the right lane.

question: When passing another car, you have enough room to return to the driving lane when:
option1: you cannot see the vehicle directly to your right.
option2: you can see both headlights of the car you passed in your rearview mirror.
option3: you are at least 50 feet in front of the vehicle.

question: On what three conditions does your blood alcohol content (BAC) depend?
option1: Your weight. The type of beverage you drink. How fit you are.
option2: Your height. How much alcohol you drink. The type of beverage you drink.
option3: Your weight. How much alcohol you drink. How much time passes between drinks.

question: If a traffic officer signals you to drive through a red light:
option1: you must not obey the officer. Signs and signals take precedence over directions given by traffic officers.
option2: you must do it.
option3: you must wait for the red light to turn green.

question: Which statement about blind spots is true?
option1: Large trucks have smaller blind spots than most passenger vehicles.
option2: If traffic conditions permit you should cruise in blind spot of the vehicle ahead.
option3: Before changing lanes, you should check mirrors and look over your shoulder toward the rear.

question: If you think your tires might have lost contact with the surface of the road, you should:
option1: slow down by shifting to a lower gear.
option2: slowly ease your foot off the gas pedal.
option3: pump the brakes quickly and firmly and slow down.

question: What should you do if a vehicle is approaching head-on in your lane?
option1: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other driver.
option2: Pull over to the left and use your emergency lights to stop the other driver.
option3: Turn off the ignition if your vehicle has power steering.

question: ABS is the acronym for:
option1: Anti-Locking Brake System
option2: Average-Beam System

question: This road sign warns drivers that:
option1: vehicles must leave the pavement immediately.
option2: the dirt on the side of the road is soft.
option3: the road surface ahead changes to a low-type surface or earth road.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Do not pass on the left.
option2: Do not enter

question: This road sign means:
option1: Turn left or go through
option2: No right turn

question: When driving in fog, you should never use your high beams because:
option1: vehicles behind you may follow too closely.
option2: the light will reflect back into your eyes.
option3: oncoming vehicles might not see you.

question: Pentagonal signs are used to indicate:
option1: school crossings.
option2: no passing zones.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Divided highway begins
option2: Keep left

question: What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
option1: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
option2: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.

question: If the vehicle you are driving starts to skid, you should:
option1: stay off the brakes.
option2: turn off the ignition.

question: When the road is slippery, drivers should _________ their following distance.
option1: decrease
option2: maintain

question: If an approaching driver does not dim the headlights, you should:
option1: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.
option2: flash your headlights to low beam for a second, then return to high beam.
option3: move your eyes to the left to help avoid the glare of approaching high beams.

question: Before passing a vehicle or changing lanes, remember to:
option1: sound your horn as you pass.
option2: signal your return to the left lane.
option3: only pass or change lanes if the change can be completed  without speeding.

question: At a stop sign there is no stop line or crosswalk. You must stop:
option1: before you enter the intersection.
option2: after you enter the intersection, if you have a clear view of traffic on the intersecting roadway.

question: This road sign means the road you are driving on:
option1: turns only to the left
option2: turns sharply to the left and then right
option3: turns to the right and then the left

question: If you are feeling tired while driving, you should:
option1: drink coffee.
option2: stop and get some rest.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Double curve ahead
option2: Pavement ends

question: Broken yellow lines:
option1: separate lanes of traffic moving in opposite directions.
option2: separate lanes of traffic moving in the same direction.
option3: indicate you are in a no passing zone.

question: If your car goes into water, you should:
option1: wait for water to rush in and let it out in small breaths through your nose.
option2: remove yourself before it starts to sink.

question: What do pennant-shaped signs indicate?
option1: Yield
option2: A No Passing Zone

question: Alcohol:
option1: makes it easier to make correct decisions.
option2: makes you less aware of what is happening to your driving abilities.

question: If an intersection has crosswalk lines but no STOP line, where must you stop for a red light?
option1: After the crosswalk.
option2: Before the crosswalk.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Limited parking
option2: Detour

question: What is the purpose of minimum speed limits?
option1: To halt the traffic flow.
option2: To allow emergency vehicles with red flashing lights to safely pass other vehicles.
option3: To keep a smooth traffic flow.

question: Before stopping your vehicle on the roadway, drivers should:
option1: place their foot on the accelerator.
option2: pump the brakes to check if they work properly.

question: These are:
option1: route signs.
option2: speed limit signs.

question: What should you do when an aggressive driver confronts you?
option1: Make eye contact.
option2: Avoid eye contact with the aggressive driver.
option3: Challenge the aggressive driver with increased speed.

question: Destination signs are ______ with ____ letters and symbols.
option1: blue; white
option2: white; black

question: Give the right-of-way to any pedestrian:
option1: if you have the green light.
option2: on the opposite side of the street.

question: BAC is:
option1: the number of ounces of alcohol in your blood.
option2: the acronym for Beer ACcumulation.
option3: the percentage of alcohol in your blood.

question: What does it mean If an oncoming driver flashes headlights at you during a period of low visibility?
option1: Your vehicle was difficult to see. You should turn on your headlights.
option2: Your headlights are too bright. You should turn them off.
option3: Your headlights are too bright. You should use parking lights instead.

question: The yield sign is ___ and white, with ___ letters.
option1: red; white
option2: yellow; black

question: Gauging the speed of a motorcycle may be difficult because:
option1: many motorcyclists do not activate the brake light.
option2: motorcycles take up less of your field of vision.
option3: motorcycles often slow down by downshifting.

question: Are bicyclists required to obey traffic laws and signs?
option1: Yes.
option2: No, bicyclists are considered pedestrians when it comes to the rules of the road.
option3: Yes, but only if they are riding in a bicycle lane.

question: This sign means:
option1: Merge right
option2: Divided highway begins

question: This road sign means:
option1: Flagger ahead
option2: Turn left at the intersection

question: If one of your tires blows out while driving, you should:
option1: apply the brakes firmly and steer toward the right edge of the road.
option2: pump the brakes.
option3: hold the steering wheel firmly, slow down, and steer smoothly.

question: If you have to wait for a space to enter a freeway, you should:
option1: slow down on the ramp and search ahead for a gap in traffic on the freeway.
option2: stop at the end of the ramp to wait for a gap in traffic.
option3: maintain speed and signal other drivers to make a gap.

question: Just like alcohol and other drugs, drowsiness can:
option1: help you to be a better driver.
option2: make you feel better.

question: Unless otherwise posted, the speed limit in residential areas is:
option1: 30 MPH
option2: 25 MPH

question: When they see this sign, drivers should:
option1: increase their speed and keep well to the right.
option2: slow down and keep well to the right.
option3: slow down and keep well to the left.

question: When you are angry or upset you should:
option1: drive fast to let off steam.
option2: take a few minutes to cool off before you drive.
option3: listen to loud music while driving.

question: When driving in work zones you should:
option1: tailgate the vehicle ahead.
option2: gradually come to a complete stop and wait for a flagger to guide traffic safely through the work zone.
option3: carefully watch for workers and moving equipment.

question: Which of the following substances can affect the ability to drive?
option1: Tranquilizers and sedatives.
option2: Cold tablets containing codeine or antihistamines.

question: Drivers under the age of 21 are subject to a specific restriction prohibiting them from driving:
option1: before midnight.
option2: with alcohol in their system.

question: You should use your low beams any time you are driving:
option1: in fog.
option2: on a freeway.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Yield the right-of-way
option2: No Passing Zone
option3: You have the right of way

question: An emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can be unpredictable. Why?
option1: Emergency vehicles must go faster than the posted speed limit when it is safe to do so.
option2: Emergency vehicle drivers are not required to be careful.
option3: The driver can legally pass red lights.

question: This sign tells drivers that:
option1: a divided highway is ahead.
option2: they cannot go straight ahead.
option3: left and right turns are not allowed.

question: What does a flashing red light mean?
option1: The same thing as a stop sign.
option2: NO TURN ON RED.
option3: Drivers may move forward with caution.

question: The following symptoms are associated with drowsy driving:
option1: You continue to yawn.
option2: You don’t remember driving the last few miles.

question: Blind spots are:
option1: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that are easy to spot.
option2: areas of the road that cannot be seen even when looking into mirrors.

question: Your BAC depends on:
option1: the type of beverage you drink.
option2: how fit you are.
option3: the amount of alcohol you drink.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Road construction ahead
option2: Stop ahead

question: Drivers should use their high beams at night:
option1: unless oncoming traffic is approaching.
option2: only if it becomes necessary.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Slow down, slippery when wet
option2: Detour ahead

question: Do not be afraid to sound a sharp blast on your horn when:
option1: when a child is about to run into the street.
option2: another vehicle is in danger of hitting you.

question: When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
option1: enter the two-way road to the right of its center line.
option2: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.
option3: make a U-turn into the two-way road.

question: Regulation signs normally are ____ rectangles with ____ letters or symbols.
option1: green; white
option2: white; black

question: When driving on a roadway with a single broken white line:
option1: you may change lanes only if you are in the right lane.
option2: you may not cross the broken white line.
option3: you may cross the broken white line to change lanes.

question: Drivers should adjust their rearview and side mirrors:
option1: whenever they need to use them.
option2: before they get into the car.

question: What should you do as you prepare to turn right at an intersection?
option1: Honk your horn.
option2: Signal your turn, check for bicyclists, and do not turn directly in front of a bicyclist.
option3: Yield to bicyclists coming from the opposite direction.

question: To reduce their chances of colliding with an animal, drivers should:
option1: look well down the road and far off to each side.
option2: scan the sides of the road to watch for the reflection of vehicle headlights in the eyes of animals.

question: Yellow traffic signs:
option1: guide drivers.
option2: when combined with an octagonal shape, tell drivers they must come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

question: If a tire blows out, drivers should:
option1: apply the brake firmly and hold it.
option2: pull over quickly.
option3: hold the steering wheel tightly and use the brakes lightly.

question: A vehicle is stopped at a crosswalk to permit a pedestrian to cross the roadway. The driver of the vehicle approaching from the rear should:
option1: not overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.
option2: overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.

question: When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
option1: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.
option2: approach the turn in the left lane or from the left side of a single lane.
option3: approach the turn in the right lane or from the right side of a single lane.

question: This road sign means:
option1: A road joins from the right
option2: All traffic must go straight ahead

question: When you back up:
option1: always look through the rear window.
option2: you should rely only on your rearview mirror.
option3: do it as fast as possible.

question: Which signs have black letters on a white background?
option1: Guide signs (horizontal rectangle)
option2: Warning signs (diamond)

question: Which of the following is a defensive driving skill/technique?
option1: Maintain the correct speed.
option2: Do not drive if you are very weary.

question: Drivers must yield the right of way to an emergency vehicle by:
option1: immediately coming to a complete stop, even if you are in an intersection.
option2: moving into the right lane and driving slowly until the emergency vehicle has passed.
option3: driving to the right-hand edge or curb of the roadway clear of any intersections and stopping until the emergency vehicle has passed.

question: If you are passing another car, you should sound your horn when the car is:
option1: going very slowly.
option2: signaling a right turn.

question: Before entering an intersection, drivers should look:
option1: left, right, then left again.
option2: left.

question: The yield sign means:
option1: Stop if you can.
option2: If the way is clear, you may move forward slowly without stopping.
option3: Go. The light will soon be red.

question: This sign is a warning that you are approaching:
option1: a railroad crossing.
option2: a crosswalk.

question: Bicyclists must:
option1: ride in a bicycle lane, if available.
option2: remain near the left edge of the road.
option3: remain to the right when they prepare for a left turn.

question: Always driving slower than other traffic:
option1: can block traffic.
option2: is a good defensive driving technique.
option3: is always safer than driving faster than other traffic.

question: This road sign means:
option1: There is a detour ahead
option2: The highway ahead is being repaired

question: This sign warns drivers of:
option1: a dip in the road. Drivers should be ready to stop if the dip is filled with water.
option2: a reduction of lanes.
option3: a bridge ahead, wide enough to accommodate two lanes of traffic, but with very little clearance.

question: While inside the roundabout, you should:
option1: change lanes before you check for vehicles behind you.
option2: use your left turn signal if you are in position to exit now.
option3: remain in your lane until you are ready to exit.

question: This sign means:
option1: The road will curve to the right.
option2: Do not turn right.
option3: Left turns are not allowed at the intersection.

question: When they see a crossbuck sign, drivers:
option1: must always come to a complete stop.
option2: must slow down and wait for the red lights to flash.
option3: are legally required to yield the right of way to trains.

question: To avoid glare from headlights of an approaching car:
option1: do not look directly into the oncoming headlights, look toward the right edge of your lane.
option2: flash your high beams.
option3: stay focused on the center line on the road.

question: When you see a "merging traffic" sign on the freeway, you should:
option1: move to another lane to let traffic enter, if safe.
option2: speed up to avoid congesting traffic.
option3: slow down to allow traffic to enter.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Wrong Way
option2: Curve ahead

question: At a stop sign there is no stop line, you must stop:
option1: after you enter the crosswalk.
option2: before you enter the crosswalk.

question: Which of the following factors affect the absorption of alcohol?
option1: Your weight.
option2: Your height.

question: When parking downhill:
option1: turn your wheels towards the side of the road.
option2: turn your wheels away from the side of the road.

question: A driver distraction is anything that:
option1: causes excessive concentration while driving.
option2: takes the attention away from driving.

question: This sign indicates that:
option1: there is a steep hill ahead.
option2: there is a side road ahead
option3: trucks are merging from the right

question: When following another vehicle at night, drivers should use:
option1: high beam headlights.
option2: emergency flashers.

question: Unlike passenger cars, trucks have blind spots:
option1: on the right.
option2: on the front.

question: ___________ are green with white letters and symbols.
option1: Warning signs
option2: Destination signs (guide signs)

question: Parking is not allowed:
option1: in a tunnel.
option2: on the road side of a parked vehicle.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Pedestrian crossing
option2: School crossing

question: When you see this sign, you should:
option1: slow down, proceed with caution and watch for blind people.
option2: always stop at the crosswalk.
option3: be prepared to stop if children are in the crosswalk.

question: Your BAC depends on:
option1: how much time passes between drinks.
option2: how much alcohol you drink.

question: To drive defensively, you must:
option1: not check behind you through your mirrors.
option2: assume that a driver who approaches a STOP sign on a side road is actually going to stop.

question: Driving at night is more dangerous because:
option1: the road is more slippery.
option2: you cannot see as far ahead at night.

question: When pedestrians are in a crosswalk, drivers should:
option1: pull over to the right and stop.
option2: go ahead because drivers have the right-of-way.

question: On roadways, bicyclists are considered:
option1: defensive drivers.
option2: vehicles.

question: If your vehicle has a mechanical problem, you should:
option1: stop in your lane and put on your emergency flashers.
option2: turn on your hazard lights and pull off the road.
option3: signal and pull into the slow lane.

question: Two solid yellow lines between lanes of traffic means:
option1: the lanes are designed to carry traffic in one direction at certain times and in the opposite direction at other times.
option2: neither side can pass.
option3: passing is permitted on the left.

question: When you are facing a green light and there are pedestrians in the intersection:
option1: you must signal your intention to cross the intersection at least 100 feet before yielding the right-of-way.
option2: you have the right-of-way over pedestrians.
option3: you must yield the right-of-way to pedestrians.

question: This sign warns ____________ ahead.
option1: of two-way traffic
option2: that a divided highway ends

question: When you see this sign you should stop and:
option1: check traffic in all direction before proceeding.
option2: check for vehicles in the opposite direction, then proceed.
option3: yield the right-of way to all vehicles coming from the left.

question: How many different classes of mopeds are there?
Before crossing any railroad tracks, you must:
option1: look and listen for trains.
option2: make sure there is room for your vehicle on the other side.

question: You should increase your following distance:
option1: when the roads are slippery.
option2: at night or if it is raining.

question: Double solid lines on the roadway mean:
option1: you can not go across the lines except to turn left to enter or leave the highway.
option2: you cannot pass.

question: When drivers see this road sign:
option1: they must turn around immediately.
option2: they must come to a complete stop and call the police.
option3: they must not drive past this sign.

question: On rainy, snowy, or foggy days, if you turn on your wipers, you should:
option1: remember to turn them off.
option2: sound your horn, as required by law in Delaware and some other States.

question: This sign means:
option1: You must make a U-turn.
option2: Hairpin corner ahead.

question: A red arrow on a traffic light means:
option1: You may turn in in the direction of the arrow after coming to a complete stop.
option2: You must stop and then proceed when the way is clear.
option3: You may not turn in the direction of the arrow until a green light or arrow light goes on.

question: The yield sign means:
option1: Drive with caution in wet weather.
option2: Slow down and give vehicles crossing your path the right-of-way.
option3: You must come to a complete stop.

question: When entering an interstate highway, drivers should:
option1: check for cars and slow down to 25 MPH before merging with the flow of traffic.
option2: wait for an opening in traffic on the entrance ramp.
option3: adjust speed to meet a traffic gap, then merge at a safe speed.

question: If a vehicle suddenly cuts in front of you creating a hazard, which of these actions should you take first?
option1: Sound your horn and step on the brake firmly.
option2: Swerve into the lane next to you.
option3: Take your foot off the gas pedal.

question: A flashing red light at an intersection means:
option1: Stop and wait for the green light
option2: Stop and yield the right of way.

question: As your speed increases it is most important to:
option1: look farther ahead.
option2: drive with both hands on steering wheel.

question: This sign means:
option1: Reversible lane ahead.
option2: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

question: When you approach an intersection with a flashing yellow light, you must:
option1: come to a complete stop, then proceed.
option2: maintain your normal speed.

question: You arrive at an intersection where you have a green light, but the path ahead is blocked, you should:
option1: stay out of the intersection until traffic clears.
option2: turn left and find another route.
option3: enter the intersection and wait until traffic clears.

question: Where are yield signs usually placed?
option1: Where major roads lead into auxiliary roads.
option2: At intersections, if there is no marked stop line.
option3: Where auxiliary roads lead into major roads.

question: Speed limit signs are:
option1: service signs
option2: regulation signs (regulatory signs)

question: What is the slow moving vehicle symbol?
option1: A reflective orange triangle
option2: A reflective yellow diamond

question: When drivers come to this sign, they must:
option1: brake sharply and come to a complete stop.
option2: warn other drivers that a stop sign is ahead.
option3: be ready to stop at the stop sign.

question: Which of the following road surfaces freezes first when wet?
option1: Tunnels.
option2: Bridges and overpasses.

question: Which statement about taking medications and driving is true?
option1: Over the counter drugs do not affect driving ability.
option2: Cold medications can make a person drowsy.
option3: Prescribed drugs are safe to take at any time.

question: Children under the age of 16:
option1: may be restrained at their parent's discretion.
option2: must be restrained only when driving on highways.
option3: must be restrained at all times.

question: __________________ is a safe driving technique.
option1: Using your high beam lights in the fog
option2: Checking your rearview mirrors frequently
option3: Starring at the road ahead of your vehicle

question: Which of the following is a common cause of traffic collisions?
option1: Scanning the road ahead and staying focused on the driving task.
option2: Pedestrians being key participants in the transportation system.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Steep grade ahead
option2: Road construction ahead
option3: The road ahead curves right, then left

question: This sign means:
option1: Divided highway ahead.
option2: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.

question: To prevent a fatigue-related crash while driving:
option1: find a safe parking area to take a 15 to 20 minute nap.
option2: continue driving so you will reach your destination sooner.
option3: drive at night when there are not as many vehicles on the roadway.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Do not use your brakes in this area
option2: Warning, curves ahead

question: This road sign means:
option1: Intersection ahead
option2: Merging traffic

question: Roads are most slippery:
option1: when it first starts to rain.
option2: when it stops raining.

question: This sign tells drivers that:
option1: a divided highway ends ahead.
option2: there is a right turn ahead.
option3: they must stay on the right side of the divider

question: What should you do in case of a brake failure?
option1: Apply the parking brake slowly.
option2: Pull off the road into an open space, if available.

question: When approaching any intersection or driveway, drivers should:
option1: pass other vehicles and then stop.
option2: drive at the fastest speed just before entering the intersection.
option3: look both ways and be ready to stop.

question: If you remain in the back blind spot of a large vehicle:
option1: you can reduce fuel consumption.
option2: the large vehicle will take much longer to stop.
option3: you increase the chance of a crash.

question: You can pass on the right:
option1: when a vehicle that is approaching from the opposite direction is prepared to turn left.
option2: when a vehicle ahead makes a left turn.
option3: when a vehicle ahead makes a right turn.

question: When you pass another vehicle, before you return to the right lane, you must:
option1: look at your interior rear-view mirror.
option2: signal.

question: What type of pavement marking shows you which lane you must use for a turn?
option1: Diamond
option2: Arrows

question: This road sign means:
option1: Sharp curve ahead
option2: Right turn permitted

question: This road sign means:
option1: Yield the right-of-way
option2: Traffic signal ahead

question: This sign indicates:
option1: a side road.
option2: a church zone ahead.

question: If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to highway speed, you should:
option1: stop and wait for a large gap in traffic, then enter the highway and accelerate quickly.
option2: merge into highway traffic as soon as possible.
option3: go to the next entrance ramp.

question: Parking is not allowed:
option1: in an intersection, unless permitted by signs.
option2: within 300 feet of a pedestrian safety area.

question: You are driving in the far right lane of a four lane freeway and notice broken white lines on the left side of your lane. You are driving:
option1: in a special lane for slow moving vehicles.
option2: in an exit lane.

question: Blind spots are:
option1: Dangerous intersection where the maximum speed limit is 15 MPH or less.
option2: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that the driver cannot see with use of mirrors.
option3: At night, the darkest areas of a road, where emergency flashers should be used.

question: A person walking with a white cane or guide dog is likely to be:
option1: a blind person.
option2: a traffic enforcement officer.

question: This road sign means:
option1: A 3-way intersection is ahead
option2: You must bear either right or left
option3: A road joins from the left

question: In bad weather conditions, when visibility is low, drivers should:
option1: drive in the lane closest to oncoming traffic.
option2: speed up to get off the road quickly.

question: To be able to turn quickly, your hands should be:
option1: placed outside of the steering wheel on opposite sides
option2: on the steering wheel, so they are at the 6 and 12 o'clock positions.
option3: next to each other on the top of the steering wheel.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Slow down and be prepared to stop
option2: Stop and yield to pedestrians and cross traffic
option3: Be prepared to stop if necessary

question: Two drivers reach an uncontrolled intersection at the same time. Who has the right of way?
option1: No one.
option2: The driver on the right.

question: This road sign means:
option1: Road narrows ahead
option2: Slow down or stop

question: This road sign means:
option1: Pedestrian crossing
option2: School crossing

question: If you park facing uphill where there is NO curb, you should set the parking brake and:
option1: turn the wheels toward the edge of the road.
option2: leave the wheels straight.
option3: turn the wheels toward the curb.

question: You reach an intersection that is not controlled at the same time as a driver on your right, and both of you prepare to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
option1: The other driver.
option2: No one.

question: At intersections marked with stop lines, drivers must:
option1: slow down and enter the intersection.
option2: come to a complete stop.

question: This sign means:
option1: The minimum speed limit is 45 MPH.
option2: Take route 45 if you are driving at night.
option3: The night-time speed limit is 45 MPH.

question: When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, you must:
option1: move into the right lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
option2: move into the left lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
option3: move into the right lane, or to the right side of a single lane.

question: Large trucks:
option1: are more maneuverable than passenger vehicles.
option2: take longer to stop than passenger vehicles.
option3: have high-tech air brakes which allow them to stop quickly.

question: What is the main reason night driving is more difficult than daytime driving?
option1: Driving within the range.
option2: Reduced visibility.
option3: The use of headlight is required by law.

question: This sign means:
option1: The road to the right is for one-way traffic only
option2: Detour to the right

question: This sign indicates the _______________ vehicles can safely travel in this area.
option1: suggested speed
option2: minimum speed

question: Some roadway surfaces are more slippery during certain times or at certain places. Which of the following is more likely to be slippery on cold, wet days?
option1: Roads in shady areas.
option2: Asphalt rather than concrete roads.

question: You are stopped at a stop sign and you are going to go straight through the intersection. A car on the cross road has stopped at a stop sign on your right and is going to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
option1: Whoever enters the intersection first.
option2: You.

question: When driving behind a motorcycle, drivers should:
option1: increase the following distance.
option2: slow down.
option3: be ready to sound the horn.

question: At crossings with more than one track, you should cross:
option1: only when the train is out of sight.
option2: as soon as the train has passed.
option3: only when the train is well down the track.

question: Aggressive driving behaviors can include:
option1: erratic lane changes.
option2: excessive following distance.
